channel.title: Can two People Host the Same Server?
channel.description: i was wondering if 2 people can host the same server. if so can someone tell me how? thanks

item.title: Can two People Host the Same Server?
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

If you want the two people to really host the same server at the same time (Cluster) the thing can get quite complex so I won’t get into that. If you just want the two people to host the same server, at different times (so as to be able to have it always up), you basically have three options.

First one, and possibly the easiest one, would be to make a program that synchronizes both computer’s data folders (It would just need to be done just before one server is about to shut down).

Second one would be to modify the server to use a MySQL database instead of files, and to have the MySQL database hosted somewhere 24/7. That way both servers could access the same database. Note that if the server is not properly designed, and if the database is not in a local LAN to both servers, this approach might slow down the server.

Last one would be to use a MySQL database too, but to have different databases in each computer. You would have to synchronize them, as in the first case, but it could be somewhat more efficient (especially if there is a lot of data) because MySQL is more flexible and powerful than just binary data files.

Read full topic
item.source: Can two People Host the Same Server?

@Luvodicus wrote:

pure ownz01:

they can host 2 server but they need to change the port. ex server 1 port 43594. server 2 port 5555

Get the fuck out… you missed the question, moron…

2 Computers… and ONE Server… not ONE computer and 2 Servers…

Lusfr:

cough use SQL cough

Exactly…

item.title: Can two People Host the Same Server?
item.dc:creator: @Luvodicus Luvodicus
item.description:
@Luvodicus wrote:

Actually you can, but obviously none of you have any idea how to share information between two computers onto a third remote server…

if the two computers you’re hosting the servers on are updating themselves from a third source, as well as constantly backing up charecter save files, then you’d be good to go…

Read full topic

item.title: Can two People Host the Same Server?
item.dc:creator: @k1ngj4m3z k1ngj4m3z
item.description:
@k1ngj4m3z wrote:

Two people can’t host the exact same server, you have to have a different IP like… lets say you hosted monkey.no-ip.biz (example), and your friend hosts monkey.no-ip.org, then you two can host at the same time.

Read full topic

item.title: Can two People Host the Same Server?
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

Hardest part would be linking character folders together. If you had the server to the point where you needed to make no updates, simply send the other person the current characters folder when you swap whos hosting it.x
